document_data.name: Leviathan
document_data.mainbody: '''Leviathans''' were an incredibly rare They were considered to be lords among all whales, serving as intermedaries between them and [[deities]], and for whom the murder of one would incite the wrath of all whales that resided in its ocean.
document_data.Description:
These whales were rarely ever seen in their entirety, with most sightings only taking in a portion of their immensity, such as their head or tail. found that leviathans were capable of hauling over a {{SI|100|ton|k|long=yes}} of cargo.

Much like [[giant whale]]s, the large stomachs of leviathans exhibited pockets of air where swallowed creatures could sustain themselves, making it possible that a swallowed victim could be rescued. Their stomachs also tended to accumulate the undigestable belongings of creatures and ships.
document_data.Personality: Generally had a [[neutral]] disposition towards [[humanoid]]s, but their [[alignment]] was generally more [[lawful good]] when it came to ocean life.
document_data.Combat: Leviathans fought in the same manner as other whales, though their unimaginable proportions made them far greater threats. They were also capable of creating massive waves by breaching the surface of the ocean and halfway leaping out. Once a ship was sank it would circle back to swallow anything it could.

Society.Diet: Leviathans were an omnivorous species, known for preying upon ships.
Society.Homelands:
One or more of these creatures could potentially be found in the Inner SeaThe original text featured a disclaimer stating, "Note that having a ship capable of being towed by a creature is no guarantee that the creature is available," meaning there is no guarantee that a leviathan inhabited the Sea of Fallen Stars. and the [[Crowded Sea]].<ref>{{Cite dragon/198/Campaign Journal: Scimitars against the Dark|70}} One by the name of [[Hamnuatha]] lived in the [[Trackless Sea]], in the harbor of [[Leuthilspar]], acting as a patrolling sentinel for the capital of [[Evermeet]]. In [[Wildspace]], one to three leviathans could be found traveling as part of the entourage of [[w:c:spelljammer:Great Dreamer|Great Dreamers]] within massive spherical envelopes of ''[[airy water]]''.<ref>

Beyond the [[Prime Material plane]], leviathans could be found in the [[Elemental Plane of Water]],<ref> with some living around the [[Citadel of Ten Thousand Pearls]] as servants of the [[noble marid]] [[Kalbari al-Durrat al-Amwaj ibn Jari]].
Society.Relationships: On rare occasions a leviathan would answer a summons of aid from [[avatar]]s of [[Valkur]], a minor [[Faerûnian pantheon|Faerûnian]] god of sailors and ships.<ref>
Society.Usages: While the bodies of whales were generally valued by sailors, those of leviathans were worth far greater sums of [[coin]]. Their carcasses could be worth anywhere from around 3,600 to 7,200 [[gold piece]]s and any [[ambergris]] extracted from their stomachs was worth around 4,000 to 80,000 gold pieces.

document_data.Trivia: * Practitioners of [[Elven High Magic]] were capable of summoning a leviathan to their aid with a [[spell]] that was [[leviathan (spell)|named for the creature]].<ref>
